scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You suggested taking a short break and coming back with a fresh perspective. [Monica] agreed, but [Bob] still seems skeptical. After the break, [Bob] says, 'Even with a break, I don't see how we're going to manage this.' You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills. [Monica] adds, 'Yeah, we need a better plan or more resources.' Now, [Bob] crosses his arms and says, 'I'm still not convinced this will work. Maybe we need to rethink everything.'
scenes.description: [Monica] looks worried and says, 'I think we need more direction. What if we can't pull this off?'

options.text: I understand your concerns, Monica. Let's break down what we need to do and see where we can make adjustments. Bob, I welcome any suggestions you have.
options.analysis: You acknowledged both Monica's and Bob's concerns and proposed a collaborative approach to solve the issue. This shows high levels of empathy and social skills.

options.text: We've faced tough situations before and succeeded. Let's keep our heads down and focus on the tasks. We can do this.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused and motivated, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: I think we should take a step back and consider requesting additional resources. Maybe we can also reassign some tasks to make it more manageable.
options.analysis: You suggested taking a step back to reassess the situation and offered to seek additional resources, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.
